conversation.content: Um, yeah so I'm calling about—wait let me—I'm calling about my reimbursement check that never... hmm, let me think here...
Hi there! Um, I can definitely help with that. So, uh, just need to pull up your account here—what's your employee ID number? I think we can, um, track that down pretty quickly.
It's uh... 447—no wait, 474-829. The uniform reimbursement.
Got it, um, 474-829... okay so I'm seeing here, hmm, your last reimbursement request RMB-9042-TK was, uh, processed on the 15th. Should've arrived by now, I think.
Right so that's—I mean that's the problem—it never showed up and I'm getting, um, pretty frustrated here.
Oh! Um, I totally understand that frustration. Let me just, uh, check the payment status here... REF-9042-TK shows, hmm, mailed on the 17th to your address on file.
Okay so that means—wait, hmm, what if it got lost? I mean I deliver mail, I know things disappear.
Right right.
Can you just—no wait actually—can you reissue it today? Like, um, I don't have time for all this back and forth.
So, um, I can definitely start that process. The thing is, uh, for check CHK-8827-MN over fifty dollars, I need to, hmm, verify it wasn't cashed first. Takes maybe, um, two business days?
Two days? I mean, do you know how long I've already—sorry, I mean—this is ridiculous.
I know, I know. Um, actually, let me see if... hmm, there might be another option here. Can I, uh, put you on a brief hold? Maybe thirty seconds?
Um, fine but—I mean just—yeah okay whatever, just hurry.
Absolutely.
So? What's the—let me guess—another delay?

No no! So, um, good news actually. I found, uh, an expedite code EXP-2847 that I can apply. We can, hmm, cancel the original and, um, issue direct deposit instead? Should hit by, uh, tomorrow morning.
Tomorrow? That's—wait no that's actually—hmm, okay so that means I'd have it for Friday?
Yep! Um, I just need to, uh, confirm your direct deposit info. Last four of your account on file is, hmm, 7829?
That's right. Listen, I'm a mail carrier—I mean we deserve better than lost checks, you know?

Oh absolutely, I, um, completely agree. You guys work so hard and, uh, this shouldn't happen. So I've noted everything under case CSE-4492-BN and, hmm, added a priority flag. Should be all set by tomorrow!
